ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Hospitality from One who is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: As a gift from the forgiving, ever-merciful (God)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: This is by way of hospitality from Him Who is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: a hospitable welcome from the All-forgiving and All-merciful God".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “The hospitality of the Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: An entertainment from the Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A provision from the Forgiving, the Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: as hospitality from One All-forgiving, One All-compassionate.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: A gift of welcome from One Forgiving, Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: as a rich provision from One who is ever forgiving and most merciful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And entertainment from the Forgiving, the Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: as a hospitality from One all-forgiving, all-merciful.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: A hospitable gift from one Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: An entertainment from (Allah), the Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: as hospitality from One, the Forgiving, the Most Merciful'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As Hospitality from an All-Forgiving, Merciful One.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: As accommodation from a [Lord who is] Forgiving and Merciful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [41:32] as a hospitality, a pre-prepared provision (nuzulan is in the accusative because of an implied [preceding verb] ‘appointed [for you]’) from One Forgiving, Merciful’, namely, God.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (A gift of welcome) food and drink for you (from the Forgiving) Who forgives those who repent, (the Merciful) towards those who die repentant.
